abstract: The results gave a broad sense of the banking industry’s troubles and drew a line between strong and weak banks.
snippet: The results gave a broad sense of the banking industry’s troubles and drew a line between strong and weak banks.
lead_paragraph: At one bank in Alabama, the problem is a construction bust. At two in Ohio, the trouble is real estate. And in San Francisco, at Wells Fargo, the worry is credit cards — a staggering 26 percent of that bank’s card loans, federal regulators have concluded, might go bad if the economy takes a turn for the worse.

headline.main: Stress Test Results Split Financial Landscape

byline.original: By Louise Story and Eric Dash
